title: tfidf
description:
Perform TF-IDF normalization of the data (typically, ATAC).

TF-IDF stands for "term frequency - inverse document frequency". It is a technique from natural language processing analysis.
In the context of ATAC data, "terms" are the features (genes) and "documents" are the observations (cells). 
TF-IDF normalization is applied to single-cell ATAC-seq data to highlight the importance of specific genomic regions (typically peaks)
across different cells while down-weighting regions that are commonly accessible across many cells.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file

input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Input layer to use. By default, X is normalized

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`. Output h5mu file.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

output_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `tfidf`. Output layer to use
output_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `tfidf`. Output layer to use.

scale_factor.description: Type: `integer`, default: `10000`. Scale factor to multiply the TF-IDF matrix by
scale_factor.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `10000`. Scale factor to multiply the TF-IDF matrix by.

log_idf.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to log-transform IDF term
log_idf.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to log-transform IDF term.

log_tf.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to log-transform TF term
log_tf.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to log-transform TF term.

log_tfidf.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Whether to log-transform TF*IDF term (False by default)
log_tfidf.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Whether to log-transform TF*IDF term (False by default). Can only be used when log_tf and log_idf are False.
